content.description: Climb up to a crack in the roof (hands/fists)and work left around the roof.  Continue to the top using the crack and face holds.
content.protection: Standard top rope setup, placements a little scarce on top bring lots of webbing.  Leadable but no pro for first 10 ft or so (5.6ish) until you reach the roof.  Pro gets a little thin at the top as well.  Can share a TR with Y.
content.location: Locate a roof with a diagonal roof branching to the left.  The route starts below the roof and traverses around it.

content.description: A fun although not entirely obvious route.  Locate a small crack in the top of the buttress between X and Z.  Find holds on the face working your way to this crack and the top.
content.protection: Standard top rope setup, placements a little scarce on top bring lots of webbing. No pro to speak of for leading.  Can share a TR with Z.
content.location: This route is located between X and Z.

content.description: X is the crack route at the right edge of Chimney Buttress's large roof.  Start up the left side of the crack eventually moving to its right side.  Continue over the small roof (crux) and up on easier terrain.
content.protection: Very protectable with nuts, medium to small cams, and hexes for the old schoolers or use a standard Blue Mounds toprope (long slings helpful).

content.description: Roofs goes up a broken crack system to an overhang (crux) and left facing corner.  The crack stays wet longer than almost any other route at Blue Mounds.  This route is a testy lead for the grade.
content.protection: Protectable (when dry) with nuts, small to medium cams, and probably hexes; otherwise use a standard Blue Mounds toprope (long slings helpful).
content.location: Starts in the crack about 15 feet right of Chimney Buttress's left edge.

content.description: A face climb going straight up the center of Chimney Buttress's large roof.  Subdue the roof with a tricky sequence, continue up on slightly easier terrain.
content.location: Begins about 15 feet right of the route Roofs.

content.description: Crummy climbing up the dihedral and into the off width above.  It was a long time ago that I did this one so maybe it isn't as bad as I remember it being.
content.protection: Standard TR set up.  Long webbing helpful.
content.location: Locate it using the huge off width looking crack half way up.

content.description: The Horizontal Tango starts up the dihedral in between Seduction and Rejection and In and Out.  Follow this dihedral up to the roof and continue straight up or stay in the crack that works to the right a bit for a harder version.
content.protection: Standard TR set up.  Long slings are helpful as usual.
content.location: Up the dihedral in between "Seduction and Rejection" and "In and Out."
Located on chimney buttress in between jugs of whine and roofs

content.description: Follow the crack straight up the big roof.  There are a lot of jugs throughout this section that make the roof very manageable.  Watch out for cactus at the ledge half way up.  Finish by working right after gaining the big ledge, ending on the face of the giant block at the top.
content.protection:
Standard TR set up.  Long slings helpful. 

  Bring small stuff if you try to lead it from what I remember.
content.location: Just north and around the corner from X, Y, Z, it's the thin crack that goes straight up the roof.

content.description: A short little route that might feel slightly hard for its grade.  Begin climbing the scattered features directly below the corner overhead.  Get your hands in the crack above the roof and transition to a pumpy layback (if that's how you choose to do it) with small slick foot holds.
content.protection: Standard TR set up.  A few long slings may be helpful.
content.location: The northern-most route on Chimney Buttress, Boy Howdy follows the corner with a layback crack.

content.description: This wide crack is on your right when you enter the cave just north of Z.  It sees little traffic and is usually dirty.  Follow this crack straight up and emerge out of the chimney above.  Practice your stemming by using the opposing wall on your way up.
content.protection:
Standard rack with an emphasis on larger gear. 

  Long slings are helpful for a TR set up.
content.location: Inside the cave to the right (north) of Z.

content.description: 15 routes or so line this large buttress.  The climbing ranges from 5.6 to 5.11.  A number of routes exist behind the buttress as well, but since this is also the approach gully it is probably best to avoid them on busy days.
